what: Turning Columns of PTMs into Rownames
title: Analyzing Pathways from PTMs: A Guide
text: /column(s) contain parts PTM names (e.g. first column may contain protein, second column may contain post-translational modification, third column may contain location), following command concatenates columns converts data frame. vector “name.columns” indices columns contain names. example , strings columns 1, 2, 3 concatenated row turned rowname. also possible name.columns equal vector like c(2, 4, 6), takes columns 2, 4, 6.
code: name.columns <- 1:3  rownames(ptmtable) <- sort(unlist(apply(ptmtable[name.columns], 1, paste, collapse=" "))) ptmtable <- ptmtable[,-name.col]

title: Analyzing Pathways from PTMs: A Guide
text: list PTMs possesses symbols unnecessary “AARS ~K ubi K747”, command remove strings included “patterns” vector rownames. pattern can chosen long user ensures special character ($ @) “\\” front .
code: patterns <- c(" ~K", "zzzz", "/", "\\$", "\\@") patterns <- patterns[order(nchar(patterns), patterns, decreasing = TRUE)] rownames(ptmtable) <- sapply(rownames(ptmtable), function(x) {for(p in patterns) x <- gsub(p, "", x); return(x)})

code: df <- yourdatastructure nodecolumns <- c(1, 2) edgecolumn <- 3  graph <- igraph::graph_from_data_frame( df[,nodecolumns], directed = FALSE ) igraph::E(graph)$weight <- df[,3]

title: Analyzing Pathways from PTMs: A Guide
text: want save data file, data structures can either exported save function loaded later saved csv file write.csv function. may also save entire Global Environment namespace using save.image function shown :
code: save(object, filename = "filepath/name.rda") # Saves object as a .rda load("filepath/name.rda")                    # Loads object saved to a file  utils::write.csv(object, file = "filepath/name.csv") # Saves object as a .csv utils::read.csv(file = "filepath/name.csv")          # Loads object from .csv save.image(file = "filepath/name.RData")

title: Graph Cluster Filtered Network — GraphCfn
text: Creates cytoscape graph cluster filtered network. Ensure Cytoscape app open RCy3 package downloaded. package RCy3 required function. download, run: (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("BiocManager") BiocManager::install("RCy3")

title: Graph Cluster Filtered Network — GraphCfn
code: GraphCfn(   cfn,   ptmtable,   funckey = PTMsToPathways::ex.funckey,   Network.title = "cfn",   Network.collection = "PTMsToPathways",   visual.style.name = "PTMsToPathways.style",   background.color = "#949494",   edge.label.color = "#17202a",   node.label.color = "#000000",   default.font = "Times New Roman",   node.font.size = 20,   edge.font.size = 8,   edge.line.style = "SOLID",   edge.opacity = 175,   edge.label.opacity = 255,   border.opacity = 255,   node.label.opacity = 255,   node.fill.opacity = 255 )

title: Graph Cluster Filtered Network — GraphCfn
text: cfn version ppi.network edges exist cccn.matrix non-zero weights ptmtable dataset post-translational modifications. Formatted numbered rows, first column containing PTM names. rest column names drugs. Values numeric values represent much PTM reacted drug. funckey table graphing gene names type protein; defaults internal database PTMsToPathways::ex.funckey Network.title Desired title created Cytoscape Network; defaults "cfn" Network.collection Desired name collection created Cytoscape network reside; defaults "PTMsToPathways" visual.style.name Desired name visual style created Cytoscape; defaults "PTMsToPathways.style" background.color Hex code background color graph; defaults '#fcf3cf' edge.label.color Hex code edge label color graph; defaults '#17202a' node.label.color Hex code node label color graph; defaults '#145a32' default.font Font style edge node names; defaults "Times New Roman" node.font.size Font size node name; defaults 12 edge.font.size Font size edge name; defaults 8 edge.line.style Type edge style; defaults "SOLID"; options include: "PARALLEL_LINES", "MARQUEE_EQUAL", "DOT", "EQUAL_DASH", "LONG_DASH", "CONTIGUOUS_ARROW", "MARQUEE_DASH", "DASH_DOT", "BACKWARD_SLASH", "FORWARD_SLASH", "VERTICAL_SLASH", "SOLID", "SEPARATE_ARROW", "MARQUEE_DASH_DOT", "ZIGZAG", "SINEWAVE" edge.opacity Opacity edge line scale 0 - 255 0 transparent; defaults 175 edge.label.opacity Opacity edge label scale 0 - 255 0 transparent; defaults 255 border.opacity Opacity node border scale 0 - 255 0 transparent; defaults 255 node.label.opacity Opacity node label scale 0 - 255 0 transparent; defaults 255 node.fill.opacity Opacity node fill scale 0 - 255 0 transparent; defaults 255

what: Build Clusters Based on PTM Data Under Like Conditions — MakeClusterList
title: Build Clusters Based on PTM Data Under Like Conditions — MakeClusterList
text: function takes post-translational modification table runs three calculations distance: Euclidean Distance, Spearman Dissimilarity (1 - |Spearman Correlation|), average two . calculations find 'distance' ptms based upon conditions occur. matricies run t-SNE order put 3-dimensional space. Additionally, intersection 3 clusters also created. correlation table also produced based Spearman Correlation table.

title: Build Clusters Based on PTM Data Under Like Conditions — MakeClusterList
code: MakeClusterList(   ptmtable,   correlation.matrix.name = "ptm.correlation.matrix",   clusters.list.name = "clusters.list",   tsne.coords.name = "all.tsne.coords",   common.clusters.name = "common.clusters",   keeplength = 2,   toolong = 3.5 )

title: Build Clusters Based on PTM Data Under Like Conditions — MakeClusterList
text: ptmtable dataset post-translational modifications. Formatted numbered rows, first column containing PTM names. rest column names drugs. Values numeric values represent much PTM reacted drug. correlation.matrix.name Desired name correlation matrix saved ; defaults "ptm.correlation.matrix" clusters.list.name Desired name lists clusters saved ; defaults clusters.list tsne.coords.name Desired name lists tsne coords saved ; defaults tsne.coords common.clusters.name Desired name clusters 3 methods found common; defaults common.clusters keeplength keep clusters ptms whose size larger parameter. (.e keeplength = 2 keep ("AARS", "ARMS", "AGRS") ("AARS", "ARMS")); default 2 toolong numeric threshold cluster separation, defaults 3.5.

title: Build Clusters Based on PTM Data Under Like Conditions — MakeClusterList
text: correlation matrix: data frame showing correlation ptms (rows columns) NAs placed along diagonal; list three-dimensional data frames used represent ptms space show relationships based distances. Based Euclidean Distance, Spearman Dissimilarity, SED (average two)

title: Pathway Crosstalk Network — PathwayCrosstalkNetwork
text: Converts Bioplanet pathways (https://tripod.nih.gov/bioplanet/)  list pathways whose elements genes pathway. Edge weights either PTM Cluster Weight according Jaccard Similarity.

title: Pathway Crosstalk Network — PathwayCrosstalkNetwork
code: PathwayCrosstalkNetwork(   common.clusters,   bioplanet.file = "bioplanet.csv",   edgelist.name = "PTPedgelist",   createfile = getwd() )

title: Pathway Crosstalk Network — PathwayCrosstalkNetwork
text: common.clusters list common clusters three distance metrics (Euclidean, Spearman, SED). Can made MakeCorrelationNetwork bioplanet.file Either name bioplanet pathway .csv file dataframe. Lines bioplanet possess 4 values order "PATHWAY_ID","PATHWAY_NAME","GENE_ID","GENE_SYMBOL". Users well versed R pass "yourfilename.csv" edgelist.name desired name Pathway Pathway edgelist file created ('.csv' automatically added end ); defaults edgelist. Intended use Cytoscape. createfile path create edgelist file. Defaults working directory, FALSE provided, file created.

title: Pathway Crosstalk Network — PathwayCrosstalkNetwork
text: edgelist file created working directory. Contains pathway source-target columns, edge weights jaccard similarity Pathway-Pathway Evidence score

title: Pathway Crosstalk Network — PathwayCrosstalkNetwork
code: PathwayCrosstalkNetwork(ex.common.clusters, ex.bioplanet, "ex.edgelist", createfile = FALSE)
